title: Reactions to racist posts on social media in the U.S. 2017
summary: This statistic presents the percentage of teenage social media users in the united who have experienced peer pressure on social media as of 2015 . During the survey period , it was found that 21 percent of respondents felt worse about their own life because of something they saw from other friends on social media .

data.Response: Comment on/ reply to the post
Discuss the content with the poster offline (e.g. on the phone in person etc.)

gold: This statistic shows the most common reactions of online adults in the United States when encountering racist posts on social media . During the August 2017 survey , 40 percent of respondents stated they would ignore the content , whereas 31 percent would unfollow or unfriend the poster .
